channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Rep. Ro Khanna discusses resolution he co-sponsored for release of Epstein files
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer speaks with Rep. Ro Khanna, D-Calif., who co-sponsored the resolution for public release of the Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: Why some GOP lawmakers are defying President Trump on release of Epstein files
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks with Republican strategist Rina Shah about why some GOP lawmakers are defying President Trump and Speaker Johnson to demand the release of the Epstein files.

item.title: House Speaker Johnson calls for early summer recess to avoid vote on Epstein files
item.description: Republican House Speaker Mike Johnson is sending lawmakers home early for their summer recess to avoid dragging out a fight within the GOP over the Jeffrey Epstein saga.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: House to start summer recess early to avoid Epstein files vote, Trump deflects on Epstein probe with accusations about Obama, Columbia disciplines over 70 students for pro-Palestinian demonstrations.

item.title: Eva Victor discusses her new film, 'Sorry, Baby'
item.description: "Sorry, Baby" is a quiet, quirky film about life before and after a sexual assault. NPR speaks with Eva Victor, actor, writer and director, about bringing humor to such a serious topic.

item.title: AFP news agency says its journalists in Gaza are at risk of starving to death
item.description: AFP's global news director Phil Chetwynd says the French news service's journalists in Gaza are at risk of starving to death. The agency is struggling to get those journalists out of Gaza.

item.title: Video of Florida deputy punching Black man during traffic stop prompts investigation
item.description: The sheriff's office in Jacksonville, Fla., is investigating a traffic stop where a deputy punched a Black driver in the face while in his car. The driver's video of his arrest surfaced on Sunday.

item.title: Texas Legislature to discuss emergency preparedness measures following deadly floods
item.description: The Texas Legislature will start discussions Wednesday on emergency preparedness and warning systems following the deadly floods on July 4 that killed at least 135 people.

item.title: How NPR's college podcast winner overcame his fears and inspired listeners worldwide
item.description: A college student shares how his award-winning podcast about his rare mental health condition has connected him to a new community and opened him up to new opportunities.

item.title: As many shorebird populations decline, the American oystercatcher is rebounding
item.description: Studies show the populations of most North American shorebirds are declining. But the American oystercatcher found along the Atlantic and Gulf coasts is a success story.
